The old forum was fine in its day, three years ago when I installed it. But now there are so much more flexible forums available for free I thought it was time to upgrade. So finally we've caught up with the present day where you can add smileys without having to insert your own image tags, where you can see which posts are new without scratching your head trying to remember how long ago you last browsed the forums, and where you can edit posts, and where I can maintain things without having to physically edit the text files.

I've had a bit of a search trying to find comparisons between YaBB and phpBB, and as far as I can make out there's not much difference in terms of features, and most people find phpBB more stable and faster. So I don't understand why anybody should be complaining - so please let me know. As far as I can gather, phpBB is one of the most popular forum systems available. Seems like a good choice to me. But I could be wrong.
